input: Which of the following people is at high risk for colorectal cancer?
options: A. People after colorectal cancer surgery.
B. Previously received chest radiotherapy before the age of 30.
C. Men aged > 45 years with a family history of prostate cancer.
D. Patients with infection and chronic inflammation.

input: Which of the following is a high-risk subject for esophageal cancer?
options: A. Have a family history of esophageal cancer
B. Suffering from chronic ulcers, long-lasting scars, fistulas, discoid lupus erythematosus, radiation dermatitis, etc.
C. Frequent exposure to the sun and ultraviolet rays
D. Those who are Helicobacter pylori (HP) positive, have a history of oral periodontitis, PJ syndrome, etc.

input: Which of the following is a symptom of bladder cancer?
options: B. Symptoms such as difficulty urinating and urinary retention
D. Unexplained persistent back pain or pain in the spine area

input: Which of the following is a high-risk subject for gastric cancer?
options: A. People with a family history of liver cancer
B. Those with moderate and severe atrophic gastritis
C. Have a history of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease or diffuse pulmonary fibrosis.
D. Have a history of occupational exposure (those exposed to asbestos, beryllium, uranium, radon, etc.)

input: Which of the following is a recommendation for prostate cancer prevention?
options: A. Eradication of Helicobacter pylori infection
B. Use physical or chemical sun protection outdoors to avoid exposure to the sun
C. In daily life, drink more water, urinate frequently, and avoid holding in urine and sitting still for long periods of time.

input: Which of the following is a high-risk target for cervical cancer
options: B. People infected with human papillomavirus (HPV)
C. Have a history of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease or diffuse pulmonary fibrosis
D. Have a history of occupational exposure (those exposed to asbestos, beryllium, uranium, radon, etc.)

input: Which of the following is an early symptom of colorectal cancer
options: A. Changes in bowel habits, constipation or diarrhea, or alternating between the two.
B. Abdominal or pelvic pain or discomfort
C. A hard mass appears at the bone and joint position, which cannot subside at rest and continues to grow.

input: Which of the following is a recommendation for lung cancer prevention?
options: A. Pay attention to avoid indoor air pollution, such as passive smoking, open fire burning coal for heating, exposure to oil fumes, etc.
C. Safe and Healthy Sexual Behavior
D. Exercise can effectively reduce the occurrence of tumors, and insist on physical exercise to avoid obesity.

input: Which of the following is the cause of prostate cancer
options: C. Chronic inflammation of the prostate

input: Which of the following is the cause of thyroid cancer
options: D. Insufficient or excessive iodine intake

input: Which of the following is a recommendation for lymphoma prevention?
options: C. Avoid radiation exposure and contact with radioactive dust
D. Safe and Healthy Sexual Behavior

input: Which of the following is a possible cause of lymphoma
options: D. Long-term exposure to certain pesticides, organic solvents or radiation

input: Which of the following is a symptom of leukemia
options: A. Pale skin, dizziness, fatigue, palpitations, shortness of breath, and excessive sweating
B. Pain and joint mobility disorders may occur and gradually worsen
C. Symptoms such as difficulty urinating and urinary retention

input: Which of the following is a recommendation for the prevention of soft tissue sarcoma?
options: A. Avoid radiation and strong ultraviolet rays, and increase the intake of β-carotene, carotenoids, vitamins C and E;

input: The main modes of metastasis of cancer are?
options: D. Unexplained lumps found on the body surface or near large joints or imaging examinations, or lumps that cannot subside for a long time after trauma

input: Esophageal cancer prevention recommendations
options: A. Use physical or chemical sun protection outdoors to avoid exposure to the sun
B. Not smoking or quitting smoking
C. Eat more poultry, fish and shrimps
D. Don't take weight loss pills randomly

input: Characteristics of high-risk subjects for skin cancer
options: A. Aged > 40 years old and have upper abdominal discomfort symptoms such as abdominal pain, bloating, acid reflux, and heartburn
B. nulliparous or primiparous women aged ≥35 years
C. Frequent exposure to the sun and ultraviolet rays
D. History of head and neck radiation exposure or radioactive dust exposure in childhood

input: Symptoms of skin cancer are
options: A. Upper abdominal pain: persistent or intermittent severe upper abdominal or low back pain
B. Jaundice: Yellowing of the skin and eyes, dark urine, and light stools.
C. Discolored patches: Irregular pigmented patches on the skin, which may be black, brown or other colors.
D. Digestive problems: loss of appetite, nausea, vomiting, indigestion.

input: Characteristics of high-risk subjects for pancreatic cancer
options: A. Recurrent episodes of chronic pancreatitis, especially chronic pancreatitis associated with pancreatic duct stones.
B. Moles appear on the soles of the feet, palms and other parts that are easily exposed to friction.
C. Frequent exposure to the sun and ultraviolet rays
D. Birthmarks that continue to grow or have recently grown significantly

input: Symptoms of pancreatic cancer
options: A. Upper abdominal pain: persistent or intermittent severe upper abdominal or low back pain.
C. Giant gastric mucosal fold sign

input: The symptoms of gallbladder cancer are
options: C. Abdominal mass: A mass or swelling in the gallbladder area that can be palpated.

input: Early signs of brain tumors
options: B. Jaundice: Yellowing of the skin and eyes, dark urine, and light stools.
C. Moles appear on the soles of the feet, palms and other parts that are easily exposed to friction...
D. Headache, which often occurs early in the morning and is severe, gradually relieves or disappears after getting up and doing light activities.

input: Which one is symptom of brain cancer?
options: B. Cognitive impairment: inattention, memory loss, slow thinking
D. Different black spots appear on the body.

input: The symptoms of brain cancer are
options: A. Digestive problems: loss of appetite, nausea, vomiting, indigestion...
B. Cognitive impairment: inattention, memory loss, slow thinking
C. Moles appear on the soles of the feet, palms and other parts that are easily exposed to friction.

input: What is a borderline tumor?
options: A. Tumors between benign and malignant tumors
B. Tumors with carcinoma and sarcoma structures
C. Benign tumors with the potential to become cancerous
D. Tumors that occur at the junction of the epidermis and dermis

input: Recommendations for the prevention of malignant melanoma
options: A. It is especially important not to repeatedly trim or break pigmented nevus in special areas.
B. Promote a light, easily digestible, low-fat diet
C. People at risk of occupational exposure should take protective measures
D. It is recommended to quit smoking

input: Ovarian cancer high-risk subjects

input: The symptoms of ovarian cancer are
options: A. Convulsions, muscle spasms, and increased blood calcium
B. Fever and weight loss occur, mainly low-grade fever, and the skin temperature of the swollen area increases significantly, etc.
C. Abdominal or pelvic pain or discomfort
D. Pain and swelling in bones and adjacent joints, aggravated at night, and the severity of pain has nothing to do with activity.

input: Symptoms of bone tumors
options: A. A hard mass appears at the bone and joint position, which cannot subside at rest and continues to grow.
C. Mental and emotional changes: mood swings, depression, anxiety, etc.
D. Seizure: A sudden onset of convulsions or spasms.

input: What does cancer mean?
options: A. Malignant tumors originating from epithelial tissues
B. Malignant tumors originating from mesenchymal tissues
C. general term for benign and malignant tumors

input: What is a tumor?
options: A. A collection of abnormally growing cells in the body.
B. The proliferation of normal cells in the body.
C. The growth of normal tissue.
D. The process of tissue development.

input: Do benign tumors require treatment? What are the treatment options?
options: A. Yes, they may require treatment such as surgical removal, monitoring, radiation therapy, etc.
B. No, they may regress on their own.

input: What is chemotherapy?
options: A. Chemotherapy is a method of removing tumors through surgery.
B. Chemotherapy is a method of inhibiting the growth of tumor cells through medication.
C. Chemotherapy is a method of using radiation therapy to treat tumors.
D. Chemotherapy is a method of removing tumors through needle puncture or incision.
